PROV-BASE-NUMBER.description:
MA# associated with Provider. New Provider Module must generate the MA# similar to the current MMIS logic for doing the same.  

Cannot utilize previously generated MA#s.  New PMM will need historical view of previously generated MA#s  

New PMM must know the logic for generating the MA#s and take ownership at a point in time of conversion
PROV-BASE-NUMBER.business_meaning:
Provider (MA) number assigned by MMIS which has a base and location information (suffix)
Governance Issue across Enterprise 
Utilize to uniquely identify a Provider in all systems
Claims would still be submitted with NPI but the claims platform would have to maintain a crosswalk between MA# and NPI to pay claims.  New PMM would become the "system of truth" for this MA# and provide to all systems.

Today there are many challenges since NPI cannot be used to uniquely identify a provider but it is the primary Provider ID on a claim.  The issue is that Providers decide how they want to get paid BUT they don't get NPIs to follow in accordance with how they want to get paid (by location or specialty).  No standard put forth by CMS that can be enforced by the States.  Medicaid wants to pay Providers the way they want to be paid even though the NPI may not be aligned with this approach.

Current Claims processing approach:
1) If NPI has a 1:1 match with MA# then claim pays
2)  If NPI has 1:M match with MA# then check the check dates of services and the state 
3)  If not match still then check zip codes (first 5 digits).  Last resort check the 4 digits after Zip to narrow to the right MA#

Fields also include Previous Provider Number and New Provider Number
PROV-BASE-NUMBER.applicable_rules:
Business Policy: All Providers are assigned an MA#. Individual, Rendering, Group and  Facility
PMM will be system of record and assign Provider Numbers in future.

PROV-LOCATION.description: This is the part of base MA # and identifies the location.   Location number must be entered by system or user.
PROV-LOCATION.business_meaning:
Providers will have a potential of three addresses. 
1. Service (physical location where services are rendered)
2. Billing (pay to) 
3. Correspondence (mailing)
•        street,

•        zip+ 4

Out of State Indicator - used to identify providers located outside the state boundaries which are treated as "border providers"
PROV-LOCATION.applicable_rules: Business Policy: the provider does not need a unique address for all three.

PROV-EMP-ID.description: Federal Tax ID for Provider. This is entered by the provider during enrollment.  Can this be verified during enrollment?  If not, can it be verified post enrollment?
PROV-EMP-ID.business_meaning: Can be a TIN Federal Tax ID (TIN) or Employer Tax ID (EIN). Nine Digit number used to identify a provider for the purposes of filing/paying taxes.
PROV-EMP-ID.applicable_rules: Business policy: Required for Group and Facilities, optional for Individuals

PROV-NPI-N.description:
The NPI is a unique 10-digit number issued to health care providers in the United States by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS).   Provider (Group or Rendering) NPI is entered during enrollment. 
Must be Validated during enrollment via NPPES.

MMIS:  Always exists unless atypical (then use MA# - Portion of it with "5" to start).  May have some scenarios where NPI  was removed such as Terminated  Providers.  Data should be good 2016 forward.

During enrollment the provider selects Atypical (nothing is entered in this field until MMIS team enters based on business policy. MMIS uses the Provider Type to know if the Provider is Atypical.

Will New PMM have logic to check the provider Type and specialty to validate if providers are atypical ?
PROV-NPI-N.business_meaning: National Provider Identifier. A unique 10 digit identifier used by health care providers to identify themselves in a standard way though out the healthcare industry and standard transactions.
PROV-NPI-N.applicable_rules: Business Policy: Must be verified with NPPES. Applies to Individual, Rendering, Group and Facility.

PROV-SRT-NAME.description: This field allows the user to enter a code which is used to sort the provider file into alpha/name sequence. Normally a name would be formatted in this field with the last name first, depending on the desired sequence. Enter the name of the provider the way it should be used for alphabetic sorting. Do not use any punctuation. If no entry is made in this field, or if spaces are entered, the system will copy the provider NAME filed. If you let the system supply the SORT NAME and then later change the provider NAME field, remember to erase the SORT NAME for sorting. .              This field allows the user to enter a code which is used to sort the provider file into alpha/name sequence. Normally a name would be formatted in this field with the last name first, depending on the desired sequence. Enter the name of the provider the way it should be used for alphabetic sorting. Do not use any punctuation. If no entry is made in this field, or if spaces are entered, the system will copy the provider NAME filed. If you let the system supply the SORT NAME and then later change the provider NAME field, remember to erase the SORT NAME for sorting.
PROV-SRT-NAME.business_meaning:
First Last Middle for Individual Provider. Individual provider can also have an alias.
Governance Issue across Enterprise 
In MMIS today, Prov-Name is utilized to identify the Provider.  If Individual, the Last, First and Middle Initial are concatenated into this field by a MPS person who enters into this field.  It has Legal Entity Name if an organization.  This field is utilized by most reports and programs (ex CMS Rule Provider Data file).  
The new MMIS fields of First, Last and Middle Initial have been created in MMIS and data clean up to popluate these fields.  
Discussion must occur on how much to remediate downstream systems/programs to use the newly Individual Provider name fields  instead of Prov Name
PROV-SRT-NAME.applicable_rules: Business Policy: Applies to Individual (solo) and Rendering Providers

PROV-LICENSE-NUM.description:
Provider's license number issued by the state licensing board authorizing practice within the state.  Applicable by provider type.  If individual provider is required to have a license, then the number is entered during enrollment in this field; otherwise left blank.  This field is associated with PROV-LICENSE-ST, PROV-LIC-EXP and PROV-LICENSE-DT.   Allow PMM Module superuser to change post enrollment.   Not captured for facilities, and based on provider type.   If errored in entry then allow change during Enrollment Process only. 
Will be validated for most provider types at enrollment via data from boards.
PROV-LICENSE-NUM.business_meaning:
Providers Maryland License.   Critical fields Include:
•	License Number
•	Board issuance date – date  board originally issued  provider’s number
•	Board renewal date – date the board renews provider’s license 
•	Board expiration date – date the board license expires 
•	Board License State  – State in which the  board issued License 

Non-Maryland Licenses will have critical fields;
•	License Number
•	License Type  - License, Certification or Permit
•	State/Province -State where license was issued 
•	Effective Date - Date license was effective
•	Expiration date -  Date license expires
PROV-LICENSE-NUM.applicable_rules:
Business Policy: 
Some providers such as Atypical do not have a Maryland Board License. 

Maryland License should be verified with the MD Boards.

DEA-NUMBER.description: Number assigned to a healthcare provider by the United States Drug Enforcement Administration allowing them to write prescriptions for controlled substances.
DEA-NUMBER.business_meaning:
DEA is assigned to a healthcare provider by the Drug Enforcement Administration to allow writing prescriptions for controlled substances. 
Critical Fields:
•	DEA Number
•	DEA Issuance Date – Date DEA was issued 
•	DEA Certificate End Date – Date DEA expires
DEA-NUMBER.applicable_rules:
Business Policy:
Documentation required at enrollment. Providers are able to add/change DEA's after enrollment.  
If a provider's DEA starts with the Letter X, we need to add Category of Service 1B because in some cases they dispense controlled substances. 
First Character of DEA describes the Type. Examples:
B = Hospital/Clinic
C = Practitioner (i.e., a physician, dentist, veterinarian)
D = Teaching Institution
M = Mid-Level Practitioner (i.e., nurse practitioners, physician's assistants)
X = Suboxone/Subutex Prescribing Program

https://www.meditec.com/blog/dea-numbers-what-do-they-mean

ProviderCategoryofService(10x).description:
PMM will track Categories of Service and then track the start/end dates per Category of Service (COS).   In order to comply with the MMIS rule of max 10 rows and 8 columns for Category of Service codes, the codes must be organized in ranges to ensure a maximum of 10 date ranges. All COS in the row must have the same start and end date. 

2/3/2021 Options discussed:  

1)  Clean up MMIS COS data and no restriction on PMM (10 max date ranges for all COS codes).  IF there are  more than 10 date ranges for COS Code then the interface will error out.  Some one must work the Exception process and manually fix the COS codes in PMM to resolve.
2)   Clean up MMIS COS data but with implement a restriction in PMM to limit to 10 possible date ranges across all COS Codes
3)  Identify the Level of effort to normalize COS in MMIS

PROV-MEMBER-NM.description:
In MMIS, the data is found on the following screens: 
For individuals, groups affiliation's are on Screen 2.  Groups - On Screen 5, it lists all the individuals that are affiliated.    

Current provider enrollment operates where the group MA# must already be on file before the individual can enroll.  Future - individual providers should be able to enroll without corresponding Group enrolled
PROV-MEMBER-NM.business_meaning:
Provider (MA) number assigned by MMIS which has a base and location information (suffix)
Governance Issue across Enterprise 
Utilize to uniquely identify a Provider in all systems
Claims would still be submitted with NPI but the claims platform would have to maintain a crosswalk between MA# and NPI to pay claims.  New PMM would become the "system of truth" for this MA# and provide to all systems.

Today there are many challenges since NPI cannot be used to uniquely identify a provider but it is the primary Provider ID on a claim.  The issue is that Providers decide how they want to get paid BUT they don't get NPIs to follow in accordance with how they want to get paid (by location or specialty).  No standard put forth by CMS that can be enforced by the States.  Medicaid wants to pay Providers the way they want to be paid even though the NPI may not be aligned with this approach.

Current Claims processing approach:
1) If NPI has a 1:1 match with MA# then claim pays
2)  If NPI has 1:M match with MA# then check the check dates of services and the state 
3)  If not match still then check zip codes (first 5 digits).  Last resort check the 4 digits after Zip to narrow to the right MA#

Fields also include Previous Provider Number and New Provider Number
PROV-MEMBER-NM.applicable_rules:
Business Policy: All Providers are assigned an MA#. Individual, Rendering, Group and  Facility
PMM will be system of record and assign Provider Numbers in future.

Will all systems and modules view the provider with the same status' and meanings reflected in glossary ?

First Last Middle for Individual Provider. Individual provider can also have an alias.
Governance Issue across Enterprise 
In MMIS today, Prov-Name is utilized to identify the Provider.  If Individual, the Last, First and Middle Initial are concatenated into this field by a MPS person who enters into this field.  It has Legal Entity Name if an organization.  This field is utilized by most reports and programs (ex CMS Rule Provider Data file).  
The new MMIS fields of First, Last and Middle Initial have been created in MMIS and data clean up to popluate these fields.  
Discussion must occur on how much to remediate downstream systems/programs to use the newly Individual Provider name fields  instead of Prov Name

Manual process to associate the new/old Provider

Provider (MA) number assigned by MMIS which has a base and location information (suffix)
Governance Issue across Enterprise 
Utilize to uniquely identify a Provider in all systems
Claims would still be submitted with NPI but the claims platform would have to maintain a crosswalk between MA# and NPI to pay claims.  New PMM would become the "system of truth" for this MA# and provide to all systems.

Today there are many challenges since NPI cannot be used to uniquely identify a provider but it is the primary Provider ID on a claim.  The issue is that Providers decide how they want to get paid BUT they don't get NPIs to follow in accordance with how they want to get paid (by location or specialty).  No standard put forth by CMS that can be enforced by the States.  Medicaid wants to pay Providers the way they want to be paid even though the NPI may not be aligned with this approach.

Current Claims processing approach:
1) If NPI has a 1:1 match with MA# then claim pays
2)  If NPI has 1:M match with MA# then check the check dates of services and the state 
3)  If not match still then check zip codes (first 5 digits).  Last resort check the 4 digits after Zip to narrow to the right MA#

Fields also include Previous Provider Number and New Provider Number

RECOUPMENT_AMOUNT.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the total amount remaining to be
recouped from the provider's payments. There is a limit to the amount
which may be deducted from each payment.

ADJUSTMENT_REASON.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the reason for crediting or
adjusting the claim or creating a gross adjustment. This field is
required ifRECOV-AMT as entered above is non-zero.

MAX_CK_BL_DED_AMT.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the amount that will be used
during the payment cycle to determine the maximum dollars that may
be deducted for a provider's warrant as a result of negative adjustments
to previously patd clatms. This field ts required tf the RECOV-AMT is
non-zero and CHK-PCT is zero.

MAX_CK_BL_DED_PCT.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the percentage of the warrant to
be deducted from the provtder for each payment cycle. This field is
required if the RECOV-AMT is non-zero and CHK-PCT is zero..

PROV_REC_ON_AFT_DT.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the first possible date a
recoupment can be taken. This is a required field if the RECOY-AM1
as entered above is non-zero..

PROV_NON_REC_ADV.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the total dollar amount of nonrecovered
advance payments (working capital) made to hospital t)pe
providers from which recoveries arc not to be made..

PROV_CST_STLMT.description:
This field allows the user to indicate if cost settlement balances should
be maintained for the provider (primarily nursing homes, hospitals and
home health agencies). Note: "0" is not applicable..

CR_BAL_AMT.description:
This field displays the total remaining balance owed to the Medicaid
program by the provider. This amount is updated during the claims
payment cycle and represents the remaining balance to be deducted
from the provider's future payments..

CR_BAL_DT.description:
This field displays the anticipated date when the remaining balance will
be eliminated..

LIEN_PROV_NUM.description:
These fields allows the user to enter the provider's base-number and
location..

LIEN_DATE.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the dollar amount of a lien placed
against a Medicaid provider..

PROV_LN_WH_DT.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the date upon which a lien was
applied against a provider..

PROV_ST_ADJ_RSN.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the date upon which the provider's
license to practice medicine in the State expires. This field is required
if BAL was completed above..

LIEN_AMT_PD.description:
This field displays the amount of money paid toward satisfying a lien
against the provider. It is automatically updated by the claims
processing system as payments are withheld from the provider and
applied toward the lien amount..

LIEN_DEDUCT_AMOUNT.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the amount to be used during the
payment cycle to determine the maximum dollars that may be deducted
from a provider's warrant as a result of a lien. Th1s field is required if
BAL is non-zero and CHK-PCT is zero.

LIEN_DEDUCT_PERCEN.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the amount will be used during the
payment cycle to determine the maximum dollars that may be
deducted, on a percentage basis, from a provider's warrant as a result of
a lien..

FED_HOLD_PROV_NUM.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the Federal dollar amount of a lien
placed against a Medicaid provider..

FED_LIEN_AMT.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the Federal dollar amount of a lien
placed against a Medicaid provider..

PROV_FED_LIEN_DATE.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the effective date of the Federal
levy..

FED_FIRST_WITHHELD.description:
This field displays the date on which money was taken against the
Federal levy..

PROV_FED_ADJ_RSN.description:
This field allows the user to indicate the reason for creating or
adjusting the claim or creating a gross adjustment. This field is
required if the BAL was entered above and is non-zero..

FED_LIEN_AMT_PAID.description: This field displays the amount of the Federal levy that was taken away..
